utterance: Crack three eggs on a bowl and whisk with a pinch of salt.
Heat butter or oil on a pan on high heat.
Add the egg mixture to the pan and stir the eggs for about 30 seconds.
When the eggs are set but look slightly wet, turn off the heat and fold the omelette.
After a few seconds, transfer the omelette onto a plate.
Cut your potatoes into evenly-sized chunks.
Put cold water in the pan and turn on the high heat. Boil the potatoes for 10-12 minutes. Drain out all the water.
Heat your butter, milk and an additional 2 teaspoons of sea salt together either in a small saucepan.
Using your preferred kind of masher, mash the potatoes to your desired consistency
Pour the melted butter mixture over the potatoes and stir everything together.
Pour half of the melted butter mixture over the potatoes, and fold it in with a wooden spoon or spatula until potatoes have soaked up the liquid
Repeat with the remaining butter. And then again with the cream cheese.
Add extra salt and black pepper.
Hold a fork flat on the pan and stir the eggs thoroughly with one hand while shaking the pan back and forth with the other.
Keep incorporating the set edges into the runny center. This takes just 25 to 30 seconds.
